default_quiet_hours: 22:00-07:00 (City states most noise is only permitted 07:00-22:00)
weekend_quiet_hours: 22:00-07:00 (same as weekdays; activity-specific exceptions may apply)
holiday_quiet_hours: 22:00-07:00 (same as weekdays; activity-specific exceptions may apply)
seo_text: Plan quiet gatherings in Edmonton by observing the general 22:00-07:00 quiet window. See the City's Noise page and Community Standards Bylaw 14600 for details.
construction_hours_weekday: 07:00-21:00 (authorization needed outside this window)
construction_hours_weekend: 09:00-19:00 on Sundays and statutory holidays (authorization required outside these hours)
lawn_equipment_hours: No equipment-specific hours beyond the general 07:00-22:00 guidance
party_music_rules: Measured at point of reception: <=65 dBA (07:00-22:00) and <=50 dBA (22:00-07:00)
complaint_channel: 311 (City of Edmonton) or EPS non-emergency for in-progress disturbances
fine_range: Varies by section; see Bylaw 14600 penalty schedules
first_offense_fine: Varies by section; consult Bylaw 14600 penalty schedules
bylaw_title: City of Edmonton - Community Standards Bylaw 14600 (Noise provisions)
tips: Keep generators and outdoor speakers off after 10 p.m.; the nighttime limit is 50 dBA at the point of reception.
Construction on Sundays/holidays should be limited to 09:00-19:00 unless you have an after-hours authorization.
Provide exact times and address when filing a 311 noise complaint to help enforcement.

templates.neighbor_message: Hi there - Edmonton's quiet period starts at 10 p.m. Would you mind turning the music down tonight? Thanks!
templates.landlord_message: Hello, there have been recurring noise issues after 10 p.m. at [unit]. Edmonton's bylaw treats this as a violation; could you please address it with the tenant?

notes_admin: Day/night dBA limits and Sunday/holiday construction window are from official City sources.

default_quiet_hours: No single 'quiet hours'; unreasonable noise prohibited at any time. Construction/loading clearly audible is prohibited 22:00-07:00.
weekend_quiet_hours: Same prohibition 22:00-07:00 for construction/loading; unreasonable noise can be enforced at any time.
seo_text: Hamilton enforces a general prohibition on unreasonable noise. Construction/loading noise that is clearly audible is prohibited 22:00-07:00. See the Noise Control By-law 11-285.
residential_decibel_limit_day: No fixed dB limit in the by-law for general residential noise (qualitative 'unreasonable noise' standard).
residential_decibel_limit_night: No fixed dB limit in the by-law for general residential noise (qualitative 'unreasonable noise' standard).
construction_hours_weekday: 07:00-19:00 exempt; 22:00-07:00 prohibited if clearly audible; 19:00-22:00 may require a permit or be enforced if unreasonable.
construction_hours_weekend: Same as weekdays (exempt 07:00-19:00; prohibited 22:00-07:00 if clearly audible; permit needed for exceptions).
lawn_equipment_hours: Not specifically scheduled - falls under 'unreasonable noise' provisions; keep use to daytime and avoid late evening/night.
party_music_rules: Unreasonable noise standard applies; outdoor amplified music on patios/events generally requires a permit with conditions (for example <=60 dBA at the property line for permitted events).
complaint_channel: City By-law Services (905-546-2782 during business hours; 905-546-2489 after hours).
fine_range: Up to $10,000 (first offence, individual) and up to $25,000 for subsequent; corporations up to $50,000/$100,000 (court-imposed).
first_offense_fine: Set by the court under the by-law (no single fixed set fine published).
bylaw_title: City of Hamilton - Noise Control By-law No. 11-285 (consolidated)
tips: If construction/loading noise occurs after 10 p.m., document it (video/time stamp) and submit a by-law complaint.
Outdoor events with amplified sound typically need a noise exemption; check permit conditions before playing music.
Provide address, dates/times, and whether the noise was clearly audible from your property when reporting.

templates.neighbor_message: Hi neighbor - Hamilton restricts clearly audible construction/loading noise after 10 p.m., and 'unreasonable noise' anytime. Could you keep it down tonight?
templates.landlord_message: Hello, repeated late-night noise from [unit] appears to contravene Hamilton's Noise Control By-law. Please follow up with the tenant.

notes_admin: Hamilton uses a qualitative standard. Construction/loading hours are explicitly set; other activities hinge on 'unreasonable noise'/audibility.

default_quiet_hours: No single citywide 'quiet hours'; Montreal enforces disturbances at any time, and most specific limits (hours/dB) are set by each borough (arrondissement).
weekend_quiet_hours: Varies by borough; several boroughs allow construction (for example 09:00-17:00 on weekends) while others prohibit Sundays - check your arrondissement's by-law.
holiday_quiet_hours: Varies by borough; many restrict construction on statutory holidays - see borough rules.
seo_text: In Montreal, noise is regulated chiefly by borough by-laws. Construction hours and many device rules vary by arrondissement. For reporting guidance, see the City's pages for voisinage and chantiers.
residential_decibel_limit_day: Varies by borough (some set day limits around 60 dBA outdoors with lower indoor thresholds; for example, Ville-Marie and Plateau have posted tables).
residential_decibel_limit_night: Varies by borough (several use lower night limits around 38-50 dBA depending on indoor/outdoor and period).
construction_hours_weekday: Typically 07:00-19:00 or 07:00-21:00 depending on borough; use the City's guide to check your arrondissement.
construction_hours_weekend: Commonly 09:00-17:00 on weekends, with some boroughs barring Sundays; verify locally.
lawn_equipment_hours: Set by borough; many allow lawn tools 07:00-21:00 weekdays and 09:00-21:00 weekends/holidays - confirm your borough's schedule.
party_music_rules: SPVM notes there is no universal hour after which noise is always illegal; disturbances can be enforced at any time. Borough dB thresholds may also apply.
complaint_channel: 311 Montreal (borough services) or SPVM (police) for active/night disturbances.
fine_range: Varies by borough by-law; amounts and enforcement differ - consult your arrondissement.
first_offense_fine: Set by each borough's nuisance/noise by-law; not a single citywide figure.
bylaw_title: Reglements sur le bruit par arrondissement (aucun reglement unique a l'echelle de la Ville)
tips: Identify your borough; hours and dB limits are defined at the arrondissement level.
For nighttime disturbances in progress, contact your local SPVM post; otherwise file via 311 with the address.
Construction exceptions (for example continuous concrete pours) can be tolerated with conditions - confirm with borough permits.

templates.neighbor_message: Bonjour! A Montreal, le reglement depend de l'arrondissement. Serait-il possible de reduire le volume ce soir? Merci beaucoup.
templates.landlord_message: Bonjour, nous subissons du bruit recurrent qui semble contrevenir aux regles de l'arrondissement. Pourriez-vous contacter le locataire afin de regler la situation?

notes_admin: SPVM clarifies no universal 'quiet hour'; construction/device schedules differ by borough. City pages aggregate borough rules and reporting channels.

default_quiet_hours: Toronto uses activity-specific and decibel-based limits. For amplified/instrument sound and many stationary sources, stricter limits apply from 23:00-07:00.
weekend_quiet_hours: Same overnight framework; several activities extend the morning threshold to 09:00 on Saturdays, Sundays, and statutory holidays.
holiday_quiet_hours: Same as weekends; construction is prohibited on statutory holidays unless exempted.
seo_text: Toronto's Noise By-law sets overnight limits for amplified sound (≤50 dBA / 65 dBC outdoors from 23:00-07:00) and for stationary sources (≤45 dBA night). Construction is barred when clearly audible 19:00-07:00 (to 09:00 on Saturdays) and all day Sundays/stat holidays. See Chapter 591.
construction_hours_weekday: Allowed 07:00-19:00 (clearly audible noise outside these hours is prohibited).
construction_hours_weekend: Saturday 09:00-19:00; Sundays and statutory holidays prohibited unless exempted.
lawn_equipment_hours: Power devices prohibited 19:00-08:00 (until 09:00 on Saturdays, Sundays, and statutory holidays).
party_music_rules: Amplified or instrument sound must be <=50 dBA / 65 dBC outdoors from 23:00-07:00 and <=55 dBA / 70 dBC from 07:00-23:00; lower indoor thresholds (42/50 dBA) also apply.
complaint_channel: 311 Toronto (Municipal Licensing & Standards); Police for disorderly parties.
fine_range: Continuing offence up to $10,000 per day; daily totals may exceed $100,000 under Chapter 591.
first_offense_fine: Set by the Provincial Offences set-fine schedule; Chapter 591 does not list a single fixed first-offence amount.
bylaw_title: Toronto Municipal Code Chapter 591 - Noise
tips: When reporting, note whether the noise is amplified, a stationary source, or construction - different sections apply.
For construction, confirm day/time and whether a noise exemption was granted.
Toronto applies both dBA and dBC limits; officers may measure at outdoor or indoor points of reception.

templates.neighbor_message: Hi neighbor - Toronto's by-law lowers amplified-sound limits after 11 p.m. Would you mind turning it down tonight? Much appreciated.
templates.landlord_message: Hello, we're experiencing nighttime noise that appears inconsistent with Toronto's Chapter 591 limits. Could you contact the tenant to resolve it?

notes_admin: Day/night residential figures come from Section 591-2.8, amplified sound limits from Section 591-2.1. Construction times in Section 591-2.3.

default_quiet_hours: Activity-specific under Part 5 (Noise Control); many restrictions apply 21:00-07:00 near residences.
weekend_quiet_hours: Also activity-specific; some activities have later morning start times (for example certain powered devices not before 09:00).
holiday_quiet_hours: Also activity-specific; follow the same restrictions as weekends unless a permit is issued.
seo_text: Winnipeg regulates noise by activity and location. As a rule of thumb, keep residential noise within the 21:00-07:00 quiet window and note air-conditioner limits. See Neighbourhood Liveability By-law No. 1/2008 (Part 5).
residential_decibel_limit_day: 55 (applies specifically to air conditioners/fans, 07:00-21:00, measured at point of reception).
residential_decibel_limit_night: 50 (applies specifically to air conditioners/fans, 21:00-07:00, measured at point of reception).
construction_hours_weekday: Activity-specific under Section 69; many mechanical/construction noises are restricted within 150 m of residences outside 07:00-21:00.
construction_hours_weekend: Activity-specific under Section 69; some devices have later start times (for example 09:00) near residences.
lawn_equipment_hours: Restricted under Section 69 when near residences; avoid 21:00-07:00 to comply.
party_music_rules: Noise likely to disturb is enforceable at any time; no universal dBA for music - air conditioner limits above are specific to that equipment.
complaint_channel: 311 for by-law enforcement; Police non-emergency for in-progress party noise.
fine_range: Minimum fines for Noise Control (individual): $50 first, $100 second, $150 third; corporations: $100/$200/$300 minimums.
bylaw_title: City of Winnipeg - Neighbourhood Liveability By-law No. 1/2008 (Part 5 - Noise Control)
tips: If the noise is happening now (for example party), call the Police non-emergency line so officers can assess while it is occurring.
For equipment noises (A/C, fans), the limit is 55 dBA by day and 50 dBA at night at the point of reception.
Provide dates/times and describe the activity (for example power saw within 150 m of homes after 9 p.m.) when filing a 311 report.

templates.neighbor_message: Hi - Winnipeg limits noisy activities near homes after 9 p.m. Would you mind lowering the volume tonight?
templates.landlord_message: Hello, there have been late-evening noise disturbances at [unit]. Winnipeg's Part 5 (Noise Control) restricts this; please address with the tenant.

notes_admin: Decibel values are for air conditioners/fans (Section 70). Many other restrictions are activity- and proximity-based under Section 69.

default_quiet_hours: No universal citywide 'quiet hours'; Dallas enforces a nuisance standard and activity-specific limits.
weekend_quiet_hours: No universal hours; enforcement depends on location and activity.
holiday_quiet_hours: No universal hours; enforcement depends on location and activity.
seo_text: Dallas relies on a nuisance standard (Chapter 30) and targeted rules (for example, amplified sound near homes, construction near residences). See Chapter 30 and noise limits in the development code.
residential_decibel_limit_night: Development Code sets additional conditions by district; nighttime specifics aren't a single citywide number.
construction_hours_weekday: When work is on/adjacent to a residential use: 07:00-19:00.
construction_hours_weekend: Saturday 08:00-19:00; Sunday not allowed when on/adjacent to a residential use (unless exempt or emergency).
lawn_equipment_hours: No citywide schedule published; must avoid 'loud and disturbing' noise under Chapter 30.
party_music_rules: Mechanical loudspeakers within 150 ft of a residence are allowed only 08:00-sunset and must not create 'loud and disturbing' noise (Section 30-4).
complaint_channel: Dallas 311 (non-emergency city service requests).
fine_range: Up to $2,000 per day (criminal fine) for Chapter 30 violations; civil penalties up to $1,000 per day may also apply.
first_offense_fine: Set by the court; the ordinance provides maximums but not a fixed first-offense amount.
bylaw_title: Dallas City Code, Chapter 30 - Noise
tips: Use Dallas 311 for chronic noise; call while the noise is active so responders can observe.
For construction near homes, the posted site sign must include the hours - photograph it when reporting.
If amplified sound is in the public right-of-way near residences after sunset, note the distance to the nearest home.

templates.neighbor_message: Hi - Dallas limits amplified sound near homes to daytime (8 a.m. to sunset) and uses a nuisance standard at all times. It is carrying pretty far tonight - could we lower it?
templates.landlord_message: Hello, I'm reporting recurring nighttime noise inconsistent with Dallas Code Chapter 30. Please contact the tenant and ensure compliance (especially amplified sound after sunset).

notes_admin: Residential 56 dBA figure comes from Development Code Section 51-6.102 (district-based). Penalties up to $2,000 per day are in Section 30-5.

seo_text: In Houston, residential nighttime sound is limited to 58 dBA between 22:01-07:59. See the official ordinance for details.
construction_hours_weekday: No fixed citywide hours; must meet Chapter 30 limits (65 dBA day / 58 dBA night at receiving residences).
construction_hours_weekend: No fixed citywide hours; must meet Chapter 30 limits. Outdoor amplified sound by establishments is prohibited 02:00-08:00.
lawn_equipment_hours: Not specified.
party_music_rules: At residential receiving property: 65 dBA (08:00-22:00) and 58 dBA (22:01-07:59). Establishments near homes need permits for late-night amplified sound; no outdoor amplified sound 02:00-08:00.
complaint_channel: HPD Non-Emergency (713-884-3131) or online report.
fine_range: Up to $2,000 per violation.
bylaw_title: City of Houston Code of Ordinances, Chapter 30 - Noise and Sound Level Regulation
tips: Ask HPD to take a reading at the receiving property line (that is how Chapter 30 is enforced).
If a bar is the source, note whether it has a sound permit and the time of day.
Record short video from your property line to document the noise period.

templates.neighbor_message: Hi neighbor - Houston's nighttime noise limit kicks in at 10:01 p.m. Would you mind lowering the volume after that? Thanks for understanding.
templates.landlord_message: Hello, we're experiencing noise exceeding Houston's Chapter 30 nighttime limits (after 10:01 p.m.). Could you please remind the tenant and help resolve this?

notes_admin: Houston enforces by dB measured at the receiving property. Nighttime = 22:01-07:59; nonresidential limit is 68 dBA at all times.

construction_hours_weekday: 07:00-18:00 (after-hours permit required otherwise).
construction_hours_weekend: Permits required outside 08:00-17:00.
lawn_equipment_hours: 08:00-19:00 weekdays, 09:00-18:00 weekends.
party_music_rules: Sound must be under 42 dBA inside neighbouring apartments between 22:00-07:00.
bylaw_title: New York City Administrative Code Section 24-218 Noise Control
tips: File 311 complaints within 24 hours so enforcement can follow up promptly.
Use white-noise or sound machines to mask unavoidable hallway noise.
Remind guests to exit quietly after 10 p.m. to avoid fines.

templates.neighbor_message: Hi neighbor! NYC quiet hours kick in at 10 p.m. Would you mind lowering the volume tonight? I appreciate it.
templates.landlord_message: Hello, I'm hearing elevated noise levels after 10 p.m. contrary to NYC's quiet hours. Could you please reach out to the tenant to resolve it?

notes_admin: Example record for documentation purposes.

default_quiet_hours: 21:00-08:00 (amplified devices in the public right-of-way abutting residential).
seo_text: Philadelphia regulates residential noise by background level and bans amplified devices in the public right-of-way near residences between 21:00-08:00. See the Noise Code.
construction_hours_weekday: 07:00-20:00 (Regular Construction).
construction_hours_weekend: 08:00-20:00 (Regular Construction; legal holidays same).
lawn_equipment_hours: 08:00-20:00 (when equipment is within manufacturer specs and sound-reducing gear is used).
party_music_rules: From residential properties: prohibited if audible over 100 ft from the property boundary or >3 dB above background beyond the boundary. In the public right-of-way abutting residential, amplified devices are prohibited 21:00-08:00.
complaint_channel: 311 (Air Management Services) or Police for residential/party noise.
fine_range: $100-$700 (escalates with repeat violations within 12 months).
bylaw_title: Philadelphia Code Chapter 10-400 - Noise and Excessive Vibration
tips: Use 311 to route air/noise issues to the Health Department; call police if the source is a party or active disturbance.
For construction, note whether the work is within 'regular construction' hours (7-20 weekdays, 8-20 weekends/holidays).
Measure from your property boundary; the Code uses background-level comparisons rather than fixed dB numbers.

templates.neighbor_message: Hi neighbor - Philly limits amplified sound in the right-of-way near homes after 9 p.m., and residential noise can't carry past 100 ft. Could you turn it down this evening?
templates.landlord_message: Hello, we're experiencing noise that appears to exceed Philadelphia's Chapter 10-400 standards (audible over 100 ft / over background). Could you contact the tenant to resolve this?

notes_admin: Philadelphia regulates by background level (3 dB over background at the property boundary) rather than fixed dB day/night limits.

default_quiet_hours: No fixed quiet hours (nuisance standard).
seo_text: Phoenix prohibits 'unreasonably loud' noise at any time and requires permits for after-hours construction. Summer construction is allowed 05:00-19:00 on weekdays and 07:00-19:00 Saturdays (May 1-Oct 15). See the official guidance.
construction_hours_weekday: May 1-Oct 15: 05:00-19:00 (state law). Outside these dates, after-hours work (typically 19:00-07:00 or 19:00-06:00 by season) requires a City permit.
construction_hours_weekend: May 1-Oct 15 Saturdays: 07:00-19:00. Other times/dates require an after-hours permit.
lawn_equipment_hours: Not specified.
party_music_rules: Large parties or events that threaten public peace can be charged a police response service fee: $1,000 (first), $1,500 (second), $2,000 (third+) within 12 months. There are no allowable hours for such disturbances.
complaint_channel: Police Non-Emergency (602-262-6151); After-hours construction hotline 602-262-7456.
fine_range: $1,000-$2,000 (police response service fee for loud parties/events).
bylaw_title: Phoenix City Code Sections 23-12 and 23-14 (Noise) and Section 2-22 (Loud Party Police Service Fee)
tips: For construction after hours, provide the exact address and time window so an on-call inspector can check permits.
For loud parties, request an officer via the non-emergency line and note that fees apply to hosts regardless of time of day.
Document recurring issues with dates/times; repeat incidents matter for enforcement.

templates.neighbor_message: Hi there - Phoenix doesn't have set 'quiet hours,' but noise that disturbs neighbors can be enforced any time. Could you lower the volume tonight? Appreciate it.
templates.landlord_message: Hello, there have been repeated late-night noise issues at this unit. Phoenix enforces against unreasonably loud noise at any hour and charges service fees for loud parties. Please address this with the tenant.

notes_admin: Phoenix uses a nuisance standard (no fixed dB limits). Seasonal construction hours reflect 2025 state law; the City still requires after-hours permits outside those windows.

default_quiet_hours: No universal citywide 'quiet hours'; enforcement is by decibel limits and specific activity rules.
weekend_quiet_hours: No universal hours; same rules apply (decibel limits plus activity-specific limits).
holiday_quiet_hours: Construction not allowed on listed city holidays unless a waiver is granted.
seo_text: San Antonio enforces noise primarily through decibel limits (63 dBA at the receiving property line in residential zones) and specific construction hours. See the noise ordinance and construction hours bulletin.
construction_hours_weekday: 07:00-20:00 (<=80 dBA at/over property line; waivers possible for limited activities).
construction_hours_weekend: Saturday 08:00-20:00; Sunday 09:00-17:00; not allowed on listed holidays unless waived.
lawn_equipment_hours: No standalone schedule published; equipment must comply with the 63 dBA residential property-line limit.
party_music_rules: At residential-zoned property lines, sound must not exceed 63 dBA (Section 21-52(a)(9)). Vehicular amplification audible 30 ft or more is prohibited (Section 21-54). Repeat party responses can be billed city costs (including $150 admin fee) within 60 days (Sections 21-81 to 21-83).
complaint_channel: SAPD Non-Emergency (210-207-7273) or 311.
fine_range: City may issue criminal/civil citations; specific dollar amounts are set by the municipal court and not itemized in Section 21-58.
first_offense_fine: Not specified in the posted ordinance; IB 244 notes a first violation results in a citation for construction cases.
bylaw_title: San Antonio Code of Ordinances, Chapter 21, Article III - Noise
tips: Report while the noise is occurring so officers can measure on-site.
For construction outside posted hours, ask the contractor if a waiver was approved.
Document dates/times and, if safe, record brief sound clips to share with responding officers.

templates.neighbor_message: Hi there - San Antonio enforces noise by decibel limits (63 dBA at residential property lines). It is a bit loud tonight - could we lower the volume? Thanks so much.
templates.landlord_message: Hello, I'm experiencing repeated nighttime noise that appears to exceed San Antonio's residential limit (63 dBA). Could you please address this with the tenant and help prevent future incidents?

notes_admin: San Antonio uses fixed property-line limits (63/70/72/85 dBA by zoning). Construction hours and the 80 dBA cap are in DSD IB 244.

default_quiet_hours: 22:00-07:00 (City guidance for residential areas).
holiday_quiet_hours: 22:00-07:00 guidance; note construction prohibitions on legal holidays unless a permit is granted.
seo_text: In San Diego, keep residential noise down between 22:00-07:00. Property-line sound limits vary by zone (see Section 59.5.0401) and construction is restricted outside 07:00-19:00 and on Sundays/holidays without a permit (Section 59.5.0404).
construction_hours_weekday: 07:00-19:00; average <=75 dBA Leq (12-hr) at residential property line during those hours.
construction_hours_weekend: Saturday generally allowed within 07:00-19:00; Sundays and listed legal holidays are prohibited without a noise permit.
lawn_equipment_hours: Leaf blowers banned 19:00-08:00 (weekdays) and 17:00-09:00 (weekends/holidays); <=65 dBA at 50 ft.
party_music_rules: 'Disturbing, excessive, or offensive noise' is prohibited (Section 59.5.0501). One-hour Leq property-line limits apply by zone (for example, in single-family areas, 40 dBA from 22:00-07:00 per Section 59.5.0401).
complaint_channel: San Diego Police Non-Emergency (619-531-2000) while noise is occurring.
fine_range: Citations/administrative enforcement apply; specific amounts are set under the City's citation schedule and not enumerated in the sections cited.
first_offense_fine: Not specified in the cited municipal code sections.
bylaw_title: San Diego Municipal Code, Chapter 5, Article 9.5 - Noise Abatement and Control
tips: Call the non-emergency line while the noise is happening so officers can verify.
For construction noise, ask whether a night/Sunday permit was issued under Section 59.5.0404.
Leaf blowers: confirm both time limits and the 65 dBA at 50 ft requirement before citing.

templates.neighbor_message: Hi neighbor - San Diego asks residents to keep things quiet 10 p.m.-7 a.m., and there are property-line limits at night. Could we turn it down a bit this evening? Thank you!
templates.landlord_message: Hello, I'm hearing nighttime noise that appears inconsistent with San Diego's noise limits (Chapter 5, Article 9.5). Would you please contact the tenant to resolve it?

notes_admin: Day/night figures use single-family zone examples (50 dBA day; 40 dBA night). Multi-family and 'all other residential' allow slightly higher levels per Section 59.5.0401.

default_quiet_hours: No universal citywide 'quiet hours'; enforcement is by a 55 dBA property-line limit (Title 20) plus activity-specific rules.
weekend_quiet_hours: No universal hours; note: construction within 500 ft of residences is not permitted on weekends unless expressly allowed by permit.
holiday_quiet_hours: No universal hours; construction restrictions apply unless a specific approval/variance is granted.
seo_text: San Jose enforces noise primarily through a 55 dBA maximum at the receiving property line and limits on construction near homes (07:00-19:00, Mon-Fri; no weekends within 500 ft). See Table 20-85 and Section 20.100.450.
construction_hours_weekday: 07:00-19:00 when within 500 ft of a residential unit (permit may specify otherwise).
construction_hours_weekend: Not permitted within 500 ft of a residential unit unless specifically allowed by a development/planning approval.
lawn_equipment_hours: No standalone schedule published; equipment must comply with the 55 dBA property-line limit.
party_music_rules: 'Disturbing or unreasonably loud' noise is prohibited (SJMC 10.16.010). For residential edges, sound must remain <=55 dBA at the receiving property line.
complaint_channel: San Jose 311 (city services) or SJPD non-emergency for active disturbances.
fine_range: Administrative citation amounts are set by City resolution; not posted as a single fixed amount in Title 20. Continuing violations may accrue daily.
first_offense_fine: Set by the City's Administrative Citation Schedule of Fines; varies by section cited.
bylaw_title: San Jose Municipal Code - Title 20 (Noise standards) and Section 20.100.450 (Hours of Construction near residences)
tips: Report during the noise so officers/inspectors can measure at the receiving property line.
For construction near homes, ask whether Section 20.100.450 hours were modified by permit.
For loud parties in progress, call SJPD non-emergency (408-277-8900) while it is occurring.

templates.neighbor_message: Hi there - San Jose enforces a 55 dBA limit at the property line and restricts late construction near homes. It is a bit loud tonight - could we lower it? Thanks!
templates.landlord_message: Hello, I'm experiencing recurring noise that appears to exceed San Jose's 55 dBA property-line limit. Could you please remind the tenant and help resolve this?

notes_admin: Table 20-85 sets a 55 dBA max at any property line; Section 20.100.450 limits construction hours within 500 ft of residences (Mon-Fri).

default_quiet_hours: 19:00-07:00 (construction requires after-hours permit outside these hours)
holiday_quiet_hours: 19:00-07:00 (construction; work on District/federal holidays requires after-hours permit)
seo_text: Washington, DC sets residential sound limits of 60 dBA by day and 55 dBA at night (measured at the receiving property). Construction is generally limited to 07:00-19:00 Mon-Sat; Sunday/holiday or night work needs an After-Hours Permit. See 20 DCMR Section 2701 and DOB construction hours.
construction_hours_weekday: 07:00-19:00 (without after-hours permit)
construction_hours_weekend: Sunday/holidays: after-hours permit required; otherwise not allowed
lawn_equipment_hours: Not specified
party_music_rules: Amplified sound must comply with Title 20 limits at the receiving property; ABC-licensed premises also must meet DC Code Section 25-725 and ABCA rules.
complaint_channel: 311 (OUC) for noise; Department of Buildings for construction/after-hours work
fine_range: Varies by section; Title 20 administrative penalties apply and ABCA may fine licensed premises
bylaw_title: 20 DCMR Chapter 27 - Noise (Maximum Sound Levels) & DOB construction-hour rules
tips: If construction occurs after 19:00 or on Sundays/holidays, ask for the After-Hours Permit number.
Measure at the property line or inside your residence with windows closed; note time and duration.
Use 311 so the report routes to DOB/MPD/ABCA as appropriate.

templates.neighbor_message: Hi - DC's nighttime residential limit is 55 dBA at the property line, and construction outside 7 a.m.-7 p.m. needs an after-hours permit. Could you keep noise down overnight?
templates.landlord_message: Hello - We're experiencing noise that appears to exceed DC Title 20 nighttime limits and/or construction outside 7 a.m.-7 p.m. without an after-hours permit. Could you address this with the tenant/contractor?

notes_admin: DC regulates by fixed dB at the receiving property (60 day / 55 night). Construction hours are 07:00-19:00 Mon-Sat; Sunday/holiday/night work requires an after-hours permit.

default_quiet_hours: 22:00-07:00 (non-motor-vehicle noise prohibitions incl. amplified music/speech)
seo_text: Detroit prohibits specified non-motor-vehicle noise from 22:00-07:00 citywide, including amplified music/speech and heavy construction equipment near residences. See Detroit Code Ch. 16 (Noise) and report via Improve Detroit.
construction_hours_weekday: Heavy equipment & loading prohibited 22:00-07:00 in or adjacent to residential areas
construction_hours_weekend: Same as weekdays (22:00-07:00 prohibitions apply daily)
lawn_equipment_hours: Not specified
party_music_rules: Performance or reproduction of music and amplified speech is prohibited 22:00-07:00 unless exempted (Section 16-1-13).
complaint_channel: Improve Detroit portal/app; Detroit Police for live disturbances
fine_range: Up to $500 and/or up to 90 days imprisonment per offense (misdemeanor)
bylaw_title: Detroit Code of Ordinances - Chapter 16, Article I (Noise)
tips: Log dates/times, type of noise, and distance (e.g., plainly audible beyond ~50 ft after 22:00).
For construction, note equipment type and whether the area is residential or adjacent to residential.
Submit via Improve Detroit; call police non-emergency for active late-night disturbances.

templates.neighbor_message: Hi - Detroit prohibits amplified music/speech between 10 p.m. and 7 a.m. Could you keep it down overnight? Thanks for understanding.
templates.landlord_message: Hello - We're hearing late-night noise that appears to violate Detroit Code Section 16-1-13 (10 p.m.-7 a.m.). Would you address this with the tenant/contractor? I can provide a log if helpful.

notes_admin: Detroit relies on specific overnight prohibitions and reasonableness standards rather than a citywide day/night dB table.

default_quiet_hours: 21:00-06:00 (70 dBA affecting residential; DTC/CF districts 85 dBA)
seo_text: Metro Nashville caps amplified/commercial noise affecting residences at 70 dBA from 21:00-06:00 (85 dBA in DTC/CF districts). Typical construction hours are 07:00-19:00 (and 06:00-20:00 June-August). See 11.12.070 and Title 9.
construction_hours_weekday: 07:00-19:00 (standard months); 06:00-20:00 (June-August)
construction_hours_weekend: Same as weekday unless a permit/variance specifies otherwise
lawn_equipment_hours: Not specified
party_music_rules: Outdoor entertainment downtown limited to 85 dBA at the nearest residential property line; outdoor music generally limited to 07:00-23:00 (11.12.070).
complaint_channel: hubNashville (311) or MNPD non-emergency for active disturbances
fine_range: Varies by section; citations issued by MNPD/Codes under Title 9/11
bylaw_title: Metro Code Title 9 - Noise & Amplified Sound; Section 11.12.070 Excessive Noise (outdoor entertainment)
tips: If the location is within the DTC/CF districts, the overnight limit is 85 dBA; elsewhere 70 dBA.
For construction, cite the seasonal hours (6 a.m.-8 p.m. in summer) when reporting early work.
Attach short recordings and note where measured (outside wall of an affected residence).

templates.neighbor_message: Hi - Metro Nashville caps amplified sound that affects nearby homes at 70 dBA from 9 p.m.-6 a.m. Could you lower the volume at night? Thanks!
templates.landlord_message: Hello - We're experiencing nighttime noise that appears over Metro Nashville's limits (70 dBA 9 p.m.-6 a.m.; 85 dBA DTC/CF). Please address this with the tenant/venue/contractor.

notes_admin: Title 9 sets the dBA thresholds affecting residential property; Section 11.12.070 governs outdoor entertainment. Construction hours are published by hubNashville.

default_quiet_hours: 22:00-07:00 (fixed interior residential 45 dBA; many other sources limited to 5 dBA over local ambient)
seo_text: San Francisco regulates noise largely by how far it is above local ambient. Residential interiors have fixed limits of 45 dBA at night (22:00-07:00) and 55 dBA by day. Night construction (20:00-07:00) requires a Night Noise Permit. See Police Code Section 2909 and Section 2908.
construction_hours_weekday: 07:00-20:00 (without Night Noise Permit; otherwise permit required for 20:00-07:00)
construction_hours_weekend: 07:00-20:00 (without Night Noise Permit; otherwise permit required for 20:00-07:00)
lawn_equipment_hours: Not specified
party_music_rules: 5 dBA over local ambient at the property plane outdoors; 5 dBA over ambient measured inside an adjacent dwelling (doors/windows closed).
complaint_channel: 311 (SF.gov) for most noise; Entertainment Commission for venue/event sound
fine_range: Varies by violation under Police Code Article 29; enforced via citations/permit conditions
bylaw_title: San Francisco Police Code Article 29 - Regulation of Noise
tips: If work occurs 20:00-07:00, ask for the Night Noise Permit number; lack of permit is a clear violation.
When reporting mechanical equipment, note interior levels against 45 dBA (night) / 55 dBA (day).
Include time-stamped clips and exact address/source when submitting via 311.

templates.neighbor_message: Hi - SF's residential interior limit is 45 dBA from 10 p.m.-7 a.m., and outdoor sound is limited to 5 dBA over ambient. Could you keep volume down at night? Thanks!
templates.landlord_message: Hello - We're experiencing noise that appears over SF Article 29 limits (5 dBA over ambient / 45 dBA interior nights). Could you address this with the tenant/contractor?

notes_admin: Article 29 uses ambient-based thresholds outside, fixed interior limits (55/45 dBA), and requires Night Noise Permits for 20:00-07:00 work.

default_quiet_hours: 22:00-07:00 (residential exterior nighttime period 45 dBA Leq)
seo_text: Seattle sets exterior residential limits of 55 dBA by day and 45 dBA at night. Typical construction is allowed 07:00-22:00 (weekdays) and 09:00-22:00 (weekends/holidays), with tighter hours in certain zones and for impact equipment. See SMC 25.08.
construction_hours_weekday: 07:00-22:00 (general); impact work 08:00-17:00; some zones end at 19:00
construction_hours_weekend: 09:00-22:00 (general); impact work 09:00-17:00; some zones end at 19:00
lawn_equipment_hours: Not specified
party_music_rules: Loud parties/voices/horns handled by Seattle Police; all sources must comply with residential limits at the receiver.
complaint_channel: SDCI Noise Enforcement (construction/mechanical) or SPD non-emergency for parties/voices
fine_range: Varies by section and enforcement track (SDCI citations / SPD enforcement)
bylaw_title: Seattle Municipal Code Chapter 25.08 - Noise Control
tips: Confirm zoning: multifamily/neighborhood commercial zones restrict construction to 07:00-19:00.
Identify 'impact' work (jackhammers, etc.) with tighter 08:00-17:00 / 09:00-17:00 windows.
Provide address, contractor name, and exact times when filing with SDCI.

templates.neighbor_message: Hi - Seattle's nighttime residential limit is 45 dBA from 10 p.m. to 7 a.m. (to 9 a.m. on weekends/holidays). Could you lower the volume late at night? Thank you!
templates.landlord_message: Hello - We're hearing recurring noise that seems to exceed SMC 25.08 nighttime limits. Please address this with the tenant/contractor; I can share a log if helpful.

notes_admin: Residential exterior limits: 55 dBA day / 45 dBA night (per SDCI Tip #137 & SMC 25.08.410/.420). General construction 07:00-22:00; zone/impact exceptions apply.

default_quiet_hours: 23:00-07:00 (unreasonable if >50 dBA at the lot line/nearest dwelling)
seo_text: Boston defines 'unreasonable noise' as >50 dBA from 23:00-07:00 or >70 dBA at other hours, measured at the lot line or nearest dwelling. Weekday construction is 07:00-18:00; off-hours or weekend work needs an Off Hours Permit. See BPHC Noise and Code 16-26.4.
construction_hours_weekday: 07:00-18:00 (Off Hours Permit required outside these times)
construction_hours_weekend: Not allowed without an Off Hours Permit
lawn_equipment_hours: Not specified
party_music_rules: 'Unreasonable' is >50 dBA (23:00-07:00) or >70 dBA other hours at the lot line/nearest dwelling; BPD handles loud parties.
complaint_channel: BOS:311 for general noise; BPHC guidance; ISD for construction; Police for active disturbances
fine_range: $300 per offense for construction-hour violations; other penalties via ordinance/licensing
bylaw_title: City of Boston Code - Ch. 16-26 (Unreasonable Noise) & Section 16-26.4 (Construction Hours)
tips: For suspected off-hours construction, check the City's Off Hours Permit and attach a screenshot if none exists.
Include approximate dB readings (phone apps OK) and exact times (e.g., after 23:00).
Route issues correctly: ISD for construction, BPD for parties, BPHC for overall guidance.

templates.neighbor_message: Hi - Boston treats noise over 50 dBA after 11 p.m. as unreasonable. Could you keep it down late at night? Thanks for understanding.
templates.landlord_message: Hello - We're experiencing noise that appears to exceed Boston's 50 dBA night / 70 dBA day standards, and possibly off-hours construction rules. Please address this with the tenant/contractor.

notes_admin: Construction hours codified at Section 16-26.4 (7 a.m.-6 p.m. weekdays, $300 fine). BPHC page reiterates 50 dBA night / 70 dBA day thresholds.

default_quiet_hours: 22:00-07:00 (residential nighttime)
seo_text: Vancouver's Noise Control By-law defines daytime vs. nighttime and sets specific construction windows. Quiet hours are generally 22:00-07:00 (to 10:00 on Sundays/holidays). See By-law 6555 and ticket amounts in By-law 9360.
construction_hours_weekday: Private property: 07:30-20:00; Streets/lanes: 07:00-20:00
construction_hours_weekend: Saturday: Private 10:00-20:00 (Streets 07:00-20:00); Sunday/holidays: Private not permitted; Streets 10:00-20:00
lawn_equipment_hours: Leaf blowers near residences: Weekdays 08:00-18:00; Saturday 09:00-17:00 (West End: prohibited)
party_music_rules: Loud voices, music, or equipment audible off premises during nighttime prohibited; amplified bass from commercial premises limited to 70 dBC day / 65 dBC night at the point of reception.
complaint_channel: Van311 (online/phone) for non-emergency noise; VPD for parties/criminal activity
fine_range: $250-$500 (typical ticket amounts); up to $10,000 per day on conviction
bylaw_title: Noise Control By-law No. 6555; Ticket Offences By-law No. 9360
tips: Include a dated log with start/stop times and how the noise affected you.
For construction outside hours, note contractor name and site signage.
Reference Van311 case numbers when following up on repeat issues.

templates.neighbor_message: Hi - Vancouver's quiet hours are 10 p.m.-7 a.m. (to 10 a.m. Sundays/holidays). Could you keep the volume down overnight? Thanks!
templates.landlord_message: Hello - We're experiencing noise that appears to violate Vancouver's Noise Control By-law quiet hours. Please remind the tenant/contractor; Van311 request #[####] if needed.

notes_admin: Continuous sound limits at point of reception: Quiet Zone 55/45 dBA day/night; non-continuous 75/70 dBA. Construction exceptions require a Noise By-law Exception permit.

default_quiet_hours: 22:00-07:00 (residential nighttime)
seo_text: Calgary restricts residential noise during night hours and sets daytime decibel limits of 65 dBA (day) and 50 dBA (night). Typical residential equipment hours are 07:00-22:00 (9:00-22:00 on Sundays/holidays). See the City's Residential Noise page.
construction_hours_weekday: 07:00-22:00 (residential areas/equipment)
construction_hours_weekend: 09:00-22:00 (Sundays/holidays)
lawn_equipment_hours: Within daytime windows listed above; lower limits apply at night
party_music_rules: Prohibited if it disturbs during quiet hours; daytime and nighttime dB limits apply at the point of reception.
complaint_channel: 311 Calgary (web/app/phone) -> Community Standards
bylaw_title: City of Calgary Community Standards Bylaw (Noise sections)
tips: Log dates/times, type of noise, and location; attach short recordings.
Note business/contractor names for commercial or construction sources.
Reference prior 311 case numbers for repeat issues to aid escalation.

templates.neighbor_message: Hi - Calgary's quiet hours are 10 p.m.-7 a.m. (to 9 a.m. on Sundays/holidays). Could you keep noise down during those hours? Thanks!
templates.landlord_message: Hello - We're experiencing recurring noise that appears to exceed Calgary's bylaw during quiet hours. Please assist in resolving this; I can share my 311 case number if helpful.

notes_admin: Non-continuous (impulsive) limits: 85 dBA day / 75 dBA night. Vehicle noise handled separately. Use 311 portal/app for non-animal noise.

default_quiet_hours: 23:00-07:00 (sound reproduction devices that disturb)
weekend_quiet_hours: 23:00-07:00 (plus: no disturbing use before 09:00 Sat / 12:00 Sun & statutory holidays)
holiday_quiet_hours: 23:00-07:00 (plus: no disturbing use before 12:00 on statutory holidays)
seo_text: Ottawa prohibits disturbing use of sound reproduction devices after 23:00 and sets daytime decibel limits (55 dBA outdoors; 45 dBA inside an adjacent unit). Construction is generally 07:00-22:00 (9:00-22:00 Sundays/holidays). See By-law 2017-255.
construction_hours_weekday: 07:00-22:00 (general); Infill housing 07:00-20:00 (Mon-Fri)
construction_hours_weekend: Sunday/holidays 09:00-22:00 (general); Infill 09:00-19:00
lawn_equipment_hours: Not specified
party_music_rules: Disturbing amplified sound prohibited after 23:00; weekend mornings stricter (before 09:00 Sat / 12:00 Sun/hol).
complaint_channel: 3-1-1 (ServiceOttawa) for non-emergency noise
fine_range: Minimum ~ $500 first offense noted by City; up to $10,000 per day for continuing offences
bylaw_title: City of Ottawa Noise By-law No. 2017-255
tips: For multi-unit buildings, measure inside your unit and note if clearly audible in another dwelling.
Flag if construction is 'infill housing' (stricter hours).
On Nov 11, note the downtown ceremony zone blackout (10:00-12:00) for construction.

templates.neighbor_message: Hi - Ottawa restricts disturbing amplified sound after 11 p.m., with stricter weekend mornings. Could you keep volumes down overnight? Thanks!
templates.landlord_message: Hello - We're experiencing noise that appears to violate Ottawa's Noise By-law (post-23:00). Please address with the tenant/contractor; I can provide my 3-1-1 details.

notes_admin: Daytime device limits: 55 dBA outdoors; 45 dBA measured in another dwelling. Nighttime relies on 'disturbing' standard rather than a numeric Leq.

default_quiet_hours: No fixed clock hours; disturbing noise prohibited at any time (see decibel limits)
weekend_quiet_hours: Same (no fixed quiet clock; decibel limits apply)
holiday_quiet_hours: Same (no fixed quiet clock; decibel limits apply)
seo_text: Quebec City's R.V.Q. 978 regulates noise by bruit normalise (normalized Leq) with evening/night thresholds of 55 dBA (19:00-23:00) and 50 dBA (23:00-07:00). Construction is prohibited 21:00-07:00 (to 10:00 on Sundays/holidays). See R.V.Q. 978.
construction_hours_weekend: Saturday 07:00-21:00; Sunday/holidays 10:00-21:00
lawn_equipment_hours: Not specified
party_music_rules: Amplified 'bruit perturbateur' prohibited whenever it disturbs; outdoor shows prohibited 00:00-12:00.
complaint_channel: 311 (Ville de Quebec) or Police (non-urgent) depending on situation
bylaw_title: R.V.Q. 978 - Reglement sur le bruit (Ville de Quebec)
tips: Note whether the sound has tonal/impulsive characteristics (+5 dB penalty).
Record where you measured (indoors/outdoors) and the background level if possible.
For construction within prohibited periods, cite Article 6 when reporting.

templates.neighbor_message: Bonjour - Le reglement sur le bruit limite 55 dBA le soir et 50 dBA la nuit. Pourriez-vous baisser le volume tard le soir? Merci!
templates.landlord_message: Bonjour - Nous subissons des nuisances sonores qui semblent depasser les seuils du R.V.Q. 978 (soir/nuit). Merci d'intervenir aupres du locataire/entrepreneur.

notes_admin: Normalized Leq uses background (L95) corrections and +5 dB penalties for tonal/impulsive/information-bearing sounds.

default_quiet_hours: 19:00-09:00 (amplified sound clearly audible at a residential point of reception)
seo_text: Mississauga's Noise Control By-law prohibits amplified sound audible at a residence from 19:00-09:00 and sets Leq limits (e.g., 55 dBA outdoors by day, 50 dBA at night). Construction equipment is generally not permitted 19:00-07:00 (all day Sundays/statutory holidays). See By-law 0360-1979.
construction_hours_weekday: 07:00-19:00 (residential areas; Quiet Zones 07:00-17:00)
construction_hours_weekend: Sundays/statutory holidays: not permitted (residential areas); Quiet Zones not permitted all day
lawn_equipment_hours: Domestic power tools 19:00-09:00 prohibited (residential areas); Quiet Zones stricter
party_music_rules: Amplified sound clearly audible at a residence prohibited 19:00-09:00; Quiet Zones prohibit at any time.
complaint_channel: Online 311 (Report Excessive Noise) or Peel Regional Police (non-emergency) for certain matters
fine_range: Up to $100,000 under the By-law/POA
bylaw_title: Mississauga Noise Control By-law 0360-1979 (as amended, incl. Schedule 2 & 2-A)
tips: For Leq limits, note whether measurement was indoors or in an outdoor living area (10-minute Leq).
Check if a site has an exemption; pilots (e.g., live music areas) have modified hours.
When reporting, include whether the sound was 'clearly audible' at your property line or indoors.

templates.neighbor_message: Hi - Mississauga limits amplified sound audible at a residence from 7 p.m. to 9 a.m. Could you keep volumes down in the evenings? Thanks!
templates.landlord_message: Hello - We're experiencing noise likely contrary to Mississauga's Noise Control By-law (audible 7 p.m.-9 a.m.). Please remind tenants/contractors; I can share details from my report.

notes_admin: Schedule 2 lists prohibited periods by activity; Schedule 2-A sets pilot live-music hours through June 28, 2026. dBA/dBC indoor/outdoor Leq thresholds apply.
